summary: This document contains a corporate resolution for Gratitude America, Ltd., detailing the authorization of its officers to manage bank accounts and financial transactions. It includes the names of key individuals involved in the corporation and outlines their roles and responsibilities. The document also references the establishment of the corporation and its good standing in the Virgin Islands. This document is a unanimous written consent of the Board of Directors of Gratitude America, Ltd., a Virgin Islands non-profit corporation. It addresses the vacancy created by the death of Jeffrey E. Epstein and appoints Richard Kahn to fill this position, along with other resolutions regarding the corporation's operations and authority. This document outlines the by-laws and organizational structure of Gratitude America, Ltd., a non-profit corporation in the U.S. Virgin Islands. It details the roles of the Board of Directors, the process for admitting new members, and the powers and responsibilities of the officers. The document also includes a unanimous written consent of the Board of Directors following the death of Jeffrey E. Epstein, appointing Richard D. Kahn as a new director.
